channel.title: How do I fix my compiler?

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

[quote=“Yorchi elite, post:19, topic:326064”]Use mine

@echo off
:menu
title Project SkillZ compiler - Running
echo ________________________________________________________________________________
echo Errors:
echo ________________________________________________________________________________
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
title Project SkillZ compiler - Finished
pause
exit[/quote]

It’s still not going to help. Compilers are the same, no matter how you look at them. They are still going to give you the same errors. You’re going to have find the missing bracket on your own.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I fix my compiler?

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Yorchi_elite Yorchi elite
item.description:
@Yorchi_elite wrote:

Use mine

@echo off
:menu
title Project SkillZ compiler - Running
echo ________________________________________________________________________________
echo Errors:
echo ________________________________________________________________________________
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
title Project SkillZ compiler - Finished
pause
exit

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @delicious delicious
item.description:
@delicious wrote:

If you knew where it was edited, then control + f, then type a keyword.

It will take you to the section that you know of that is possibly missing a bracket.

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

You’ll have to find out where it is on your own. Find out where you last edited the client class and see if you have enough { to go with }. Also, just open up the client class with any text editor.

item.source: How do I fix my compiler?

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

skellz:

i’ve tried downloading that one, but i cant find it on their website…

Download this:

http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/widget/jdk6.jsp

Click the orange download button that says “Download”. It’ll download it and you just need to install it. Install it, and then go back to your compiler and edit it. Put this into it:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

Read full topic

item.source: How do I fix my compiler?

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Download it then, because it can’t find it if you don’t have it. Download JDK6u17 and install it. Then go into the .bat file and change this:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

To this:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: How do I fix my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @skellz skellz
item.description:
@skellz wrote:

Hi, ‘the system cannot find the path specified’ comes up when i try to run the compiler.
on notepad, this is what it looks like:

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

that’s the end of it.
and uhh, what is the compiler actually for?

Read full topic
